newsitem.title: INDIA: India National Exchange changes trading hours.
newsitem.headline: India National Exchange changes trading hours.

text.p: India's National Stock Exchange (NSE) today said it has revised trading hours from Thursday due to satellite problems.
Trading time from Thursday has been set from 9.00 a.m. (0330 GMT) to 2.30 p.m. (0900 GMT), a NSE official said.
On Wednesday, the exchange said it had extended its weekly settlement that normally ends on Tuesday by one day. Trading for the new account will begin on Thursday, the offical said.
Satellite problems had forced the NSE to revise trading hours from last week to between 9.30 a.m. (0400 GMT) and 3.00 p.m. (0930 GMT).
The exchange normally runs from 10.00 a.m. (0430 GMT) to 3.30 p.m. (1000 GMT).
